The main issue regarding NEAT supporting FS-NEAT was that my original 
NEAT=
 code cannot implement any form of FS-NEAT because input or 
output that is=
 not connected to the network in a genome is thrown 
away when reproduction=
 occurs.  Therefore, my original code would 
just end up throwing away most=
 of the nodes if you tried to start 
with some of them disconnected.

The r=
tNEAT release repairs this problem- it actually transfers 
disconnected nod=
es from parents ot children.  That way, you can 
safely begin with some inp=
uts disconnected, and evolution can decide 
whether/how to connect them.

W=
hen I noted on the NEAT Users Page that rtNEAT supports FS-NEAT, 
that is t=
he issue I was referring to.

ken
